text: Óscar Collazos (born in Bahía Solano, 29 August 1942 – died Bogotá, 17 May 2015) was a Colombian writer, journalist, essayist and literary critic. He wrote 18 novels, 17 collections of short stories and a wide-ranging series of critical works. Among his best-known books are: Rencor (2006), Cartagena en la olla podrida (2001), Desplazados del futuro (2003), Señor sombra (2009), En la laguna más profunda (2011) and Tierra quemada (2013). ==References== Category:Colombian journalists Category:Colombian essayists Category:Colombian male short story writers Category:Colombian short story writers Category:Colombian literary critics Category:People from Chocó Department Category:1942 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Male journalists Category:Colombian male novelists Category:Male essayists Category:20th- century Colombian novelists Category:21st-century Colombian novelists Category:20th-century short story writers Category:21st-century short story writers Category:20th-century essayists Category:21st-century essayists Category:20th-century male writers Category:21st-century male writers
